<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">and related equity securities receiving no distribution on account of their interest and cancellation of the equity. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Option and Warrant Exercises </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">There were no option or Warrant exercises by the named executive officers
during the fiscal year </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ended December 31, 2004. The following table sets forth (i) the number of shares covered by </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">options and Warrants (both exercisable and unexercisable) as of December 31, 2004 and (ii) the </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">respective value for &#147;in-the-money&#148; options and Warrants, which represents the positive spread </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">between the
exercise price of existing options and Warrants and the fair market value of </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">US Airways Group&#146;s Class A Common Stock at December 31, 2004. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Aggregate Option/Warrant Exercises in Last Fiscal Year and

<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#151;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Retirement Benefits </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Qualified Retirement Plan. </I>US Airways previously maintained a
defined benefit retirement plan </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(the Retirement Plan) for its salaried employees which provided noncontributory benefits based upon </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">years of service and the employee&#146;s highest three-year average annual compensation during the last ten </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">calendar years of service. The Retirement Plan was frozen in 1991, but benefits accrued as of the date </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the plan was frozen
remain outstanding until they are paid to participants. Under the Retirement Plan, </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">benefits were generally payable commencing at age 65. However, the
Retirement Plan provided </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">reduced early retirement benefits commencing as early as age 55. Benefits under the Retirement Plan </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">were integrated with the Social Security program. Compensation under the Retirement Plan included </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the employee&#146;s total compensation as reported on Form W-2, plus exclusions from income due to </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">employee elections under
Sections 401(k), 125 and 132(f)(4) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">amended (the Internal Revenue Code), minus any imputed income due to the
exercise of stock options, </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">income resulting from group term insurance, income imputed due to air pass privileges, expense </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">reimbursements and deferred compensation received in the form of a lump sum distribution. This </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">definition of compensation excludes the following items reported as compensation under the Summary </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Compensation Table: (i)
imputed income from stock options, (ii) income resulting from group term </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">insurance, (iii) income imputed due to air pass privileges, and (iv) certain
expense reimbursements. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On November 12, 2004, US Airways filed a motion requesting a determination from the Bankruptcy </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Court that US Airways satisfied the financial requirements for a &#147;distress termination&#148; of the </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Retirement Plan, which the Bankruptcy Court approved on January 6, 2005. The Retirement Plan was </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">terminated effective
January 17, 2005, by agreement between the PBGC and US Airways. Effective </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">February 1, 2005, the PBGC was appointed trustee for the plan. Other than Mr.
Crellin, none of the </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">named executive officers participated in the Retirement Plan. Mr. Crellin has two years of Credited </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Service under the Retirement Plan. Assuming retirement effective January 1, 2005 and payment in the </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">110 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">form of a single life annuity under the Retirement Plan, Mr. Crellin would receive payments of </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">$1,896.85 per month through January 31, 2009, reduced to $1,799.48 per month from February 1, </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2009 through November 30, 2013, and further reduced to $1,755.22 per month on and after December </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1, 2013. If the payment
were made in the form of a joint and 50% survivor annuity with Mr. Crellin&#146;s </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">spouse as beneficiary under the Retirement Plan, Mr. Crellin would
receive payments of $1,701.47 per </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">month through January 31, 2009, reduced to $1,614.13 per month from February 1, 2009 through </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">November 30, 2013, and further reduced to $1,574.43 per month on and after December 1, 2013, and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">upon Mr. Crellin&#146;s death his surviving spouse would receive 50% of the monthly payment amounts for </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">her life. As a
result of the termination of the Retirement Plan, Mr. Crellin&#146;s benefits may be reduced. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Executive Defined Contribution Plans</I>. Messrs. Crellin, Glass and Baldanza and Ms. Lanier will </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">receive a defined
contribution benefit under the US Airways Funded Executive Defined Contribution </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Plan and the US Airways Unfunded Executive Defined Contribution Plan (the
Executive Plans), and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr. Siegel and Mr. Cohen received benefits under the Executive Plans in connection with the </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">termination of their employment during 2004. Under the Executive Plans, a contribution is credited to </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">each participant each year, the amount of which is individually determined based upon age, service </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">and projected earnings
(including target annual bonus) such that the annual contribution to the </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Executive Plans and an assumed 8% investment return will achieve a target annual
benefit of 50% of </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">final average earnings (based on total cash compensation) at normal retirement age (age 62) when </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">combined with the executive&#146;s benefits under the tax-qualified retirement plans maintained by </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">US Airways. The annual contribution to the Funded Executive Defined Contribution Plan may not </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">exceed 64% of the
executive&#146;s earnings for the year, and the annual allocation to the Unfunded </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Executive Defined Contribution Plan may not exceed 16% of the
executive&#146;s earnings for the year. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under the Executive Plans, contributions for disabled executives will continue during the period of </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">disability benefits, and contributions continue for the first twelve months following an executive </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">starting an absence from work due to the birth, adoption or caring for a child after birth or adoption, or </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">due to
pregnancy. Furthermore, upon termination of an executive on or after the occurrence of a </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">change in control (as defined in the Executive Plans), US Airways
will make an additional </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">contribution or allocation to the Executive Plans for the year in which the termination of employment </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">occurs, in the amount equal to the allocations that US Airways would have had to make during the </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">years for which US Airways would be required to continue to provide such benefits under the </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">executive&#146;s employment
agreement or severance agreement. Participants in the Executive Plans do </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">not receive employer contributions under the tax-qualified retirement plans
sponsored by US Airways </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(including the 401(k) and money purchase pension plans) or under any other nonqualified defined </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">contribution plans associated with the tax-qualified retirement plans. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Messrs. Crellin, Glass and Baldanza and Ms. Lanier receive a benefit based upon three years of </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">credited service for each of the first five years of service (beginning on date of hire), and thereafter two </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">years of credited service for each actual year of service up to a maximum of 30 years of credited </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">service. Contributions
and allocations are fully vested. In connection with his termination of </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">employment on January 15, 2005, Mr. Baldanza received his benefits under the
Executive Plans in </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">accordance with the terms of the respective plans, as described below. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Eighty percent (80%) of the target benefit amount is calculated under the Funded Executive </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Defined Contribution Plan and reduced to present value based on actuarial assumption under that plan, </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">which amount, less the maximum amount of 401(k) contributions permitted for the year, is contributed </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">to a secular trust on
a monthly basis, subject to certain limitations on the total amount that can be </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">contributed on an annual basis. Participants also receive a payment to
cover any income tax liabilities </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">incurred in connection with the contributions to the secular trust. The remainder of the target benefit </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">amount is unfunded and is credited to an account with an assumed annual 8% rate of return. Under </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">letter agreements entered into with Ms. Lanier, Mr. Baldanza, Mr. Crellin and Mr. Glass on October </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">20, 2004, contributions
under the Executive Plans after October 11, 2004 are subject to a 25% </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">reduction. Distributions from the Funded Executive Defined Contribution Plan will be
made to </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">participants upon termination of employment in a single lump sum payment in cash. Distributions </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">from the Unfunded Executive Defined Contribution Plan will be made to participants in a single lump </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">111 </FONT></P>

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">sum payment in cash after the later of termination of employment or attainment of age 62. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Employment and Severance Agreements </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">US Airways has entered into employment agreements with Bruce R. Lakefield
and Elizabeth K. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Lanier. In addition, US Airways is a party to severance agreements, which in substance are </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">employment agreements as well, with Alan W. Crellin, Jerrold A. Glass and B. Ben Baldanza. The </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Company has entered into a Separation Agreement and Supplemental Separation Agreement with </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">David N. Siegel and a Separation
and Consulting Agreement with Neal S. Cohen. All employment- </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">related agreements with Mr. Lakefield, Mr. Crellin, Ms. Lanier and Mr. Glass have not yet been
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">assumed and are subject to modification prior to the Company&#146;s emergence from bankruptcy. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Employment Agreement with Bruce R. Lakefield </I></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">US Airways Group and US Airways entered into an Employment Agreement with
Mr. Lakefield </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">April 19, 2004, which is filed as Exhibit 10.6 to US Airways&#146; Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q for </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the quarter ended September 30, 2004. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Term of Employment</I>. The agreement provides for Mr. Lakefield to serve as US Airways&#146; Chief </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Executive Officer and President on an at-will basis. Upon a change of control, the agreement will </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">become effective for a two-year term and terminate at the end of the two-year period. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Salary and Benefits</I>. Under the agreement, Mr. Lakefield is entitled to an annual base salary of </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">not less than $425,000, subject to annual increases consistent with those provided to other key </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">employees. Under the agreement, Mr. Lakefield received 471,200 shares of restricted stock and a </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">nonqualified option to
purchase 288,800 shares of Class A Common Stock at a price of $1.59 per </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">share, each under the 2003 Stock Incentive Plan, which awards vest in 25%
increments on each </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">April 19, beginning in 2005. In addition to base salary, the agreement provides that Mr. Lakefield </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">will be awarded an annual bonus in accordance with US Airways Group&#146;s Incentive Compensation </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Plan (ICP) (or successor plan) and will be eligible to participate in the Long-Term Incentive Plan </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(LTIP), each as
determined by the Board or the Human Resources Committee. Mr. Lakefield </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">waived his participation in the ICP and the LTIP until US Airways returns to
profitability. Mr. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Lakefield also waived participation in the Executive Plans and in all tax-qualified retirement plans </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">and nonqualified retirement or deferred compensation plans sponsored by US Airways Group or </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">US Airways. Mr. Lakefield is entitled to participate in all welfare benefit and fringe benefit plans </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">provided to other
officers. At the time the agreement was executed, those benefits included on-line </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">first class, positive space travel privileges for business and pleasure
for Mr. Lakefield and his </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">eligible family members, as well as a limited number of non-eligible family members and unrelated </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">persons, a gross-up payment (up to a maximum of $10,000) to cover his tax liability resulting from </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">such travel, free access to US Airways Club facilities for him and his eligible family members, and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">certain temporary
living expenses. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Termination of Employment</I>. Mr.
Lakefield&#146;s employment may be terminated at any time by </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">mutual agreement, and terminates automatically upon his death. US Airways or US Airways Group
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">may also terminate the agreement upon ten days&#146; written notice upon Mr. Lakefield&#146;s disability, or </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">immediately at any time for &#147;cause&#148; (as defined in the agreement). Mr. Lakefield may voluntarily </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">terminate his employment, which may constitute termination for &#147;good reason&#148; upon certain events </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">defined in the
agreement. In the event of any termination by US Airways or US Airways Group for </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">cause or by Mr. Lakefield for good reason, the terminating party must give
written notice that </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">indicates the specific termination provision in the agreement that is relied upon and sets forth in </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">reasonable detail the facts and circumstances that are the basis for the termination, as well as the </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">termination date, which may not be more than 15 days after the notice date. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Obligations Upon Termination</I>. After two years of service with US Airways Group, including </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">as a member of the Board, Mr. Lakefield will become vested in lifetime on-line, first class, positive </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">112 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">space travel privileges for business and pleasure for him and his eligible family members. If Mr. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Lakefield&#146;s employment is terminated for cause, due to death or disability, or is voluntarily </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">terminated by Mr. Lakefield without &#147;good reason,&#148; Mr. Lakefield is entitled to receive all salary </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">and vacation
accrued through the date of termination, within 30 days of the date of termination. If </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr. Lakefield&#146;s employment is terminated due to death or
disability, US Airways must also pay a </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">prorated annual bonus if annual bonuses are paid to executives for the year in which termination </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">occurs. If, prior to a change of control, US Airways or US Airways Group terminates Mr. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Lakefield&#146;s employment other than for cause or if Mr. Lakefield terminates his employment for </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">good reason, (i) Mr.
Lakefield is entitled to receive all salary and vacation accrued through the date </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">of termination, within 30 days of the date of termination, and US Airways
must pay a prorated </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">annual bonus if annual bonuses are paid to executives for the year in which termination occurs, and </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) Mr. Lakefield may negotiate a separate severance agreement providing severance pay and/or </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">additional benefits, subject to his execution of a general release and covenant not to sue the </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">company. If, within two
years after a change of control, US Airways or US Airways Group </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">terminates Mr. Lakefield&#146;s employment other than for cause or if Mr. Lakefield
terminates his </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">employment for good reason, Mr. Lakefield is entitled to: (i) accrued but unpaid base salary and </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">vacation; (ii) three times base salary (unreduced for any reductions then in effect) plus target annual </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">bonus for the year in which termination occurs; (iii) three times the greater of 125% of unreduced </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">base salary or the
target LTIP award that would have been paid for the period ending in the year of </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">termination; (iv) continuation of medical, dental, vision and prescription
drug coverages for Mr. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Lakefield and his dependents for 24 months on the same premium and coverage basis as active </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">officers (or an equivalent payment); (v) continuation of life insurance coverage for 24 months (or an </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">equivalent payment); and (vi) on-line travel privileges to Mr. Lakefield and his eligible family </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">members for life.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Other Obligations</I>. In the event that any of Mr.
Lakefield&#146;s compensation (whether required </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">under the agreement or otherwise) would be subject to an excise tax under Internal Revenue Code </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Section 4999, US Airways is required to pay Mr. Lakefield an additional gross-up payment, such </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">that after payment of all taxes, including interest or penalties, on the gross-up payment, Mr. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Lakefield will retain an
amount of the gross-up payment equal to the excise tax (and any penalties </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">and interest on the excise tax). Mr. Lakefield agreed to hold US Airways
Group&#146;s and US Airways&#146; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">secret or confidential information, knowledge or data as confidential, including after termination of </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">employment, and agreed to nonsolicitation of customers and employees for one year after termination. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Employment Agreement with Elizabeth K. Lanier </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">US Airways&#146; Employment Agreement with Ms. Lanier is dated as of March 1, 2003 and is filed as </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Exhibit 10.5 to US Airways&#146; Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2003. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Employment Agreement was amended by a letter agreement dated October 20, 2004, which is </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">filed as Exhibit 10.38 to this
Annual Report. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Term of Employment</I>. The agreement
provides for Ms. Lanier to serve as US Airways&#146; Executive </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Vice President-Corporate Affairs and General Counsel. Ms. Lanier will serve for an initial
term of </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">three years, to be extended each year by one additional year unless either US Airways or Ms. Lanier </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">provides notice that the term will not be extended, or, if a shorter period, until the first day of the </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">month following Ms. Lanier&#146;s 65</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#000000"><SUP>th</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000"> birthday (which is defined in the agreement
as Ms. Lanier&#146;s </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;normal retirement date&#148;). Upon a &#147;change of control&#148; (as defined in the agreement), the term of the </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">agreement is automatically extended through the third anniversary of the date of the change of control </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">or through Ms. Lanier&#146;s normal retirement date, whichever is earlier. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Salary and Benefits</I>. Under the agreement, Ms. Lanier is entitled to an annual base salary of not </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">less than $425,000 for the initial 12 months of the term, subject to a 17% salary reduction. Ms. Lanier </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">is entitled to salary increases in accordance with increases awarded to other key employees and her </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">salary generally may
not be decreased, except that pursuant to the letter agreement that amended the </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">113 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">employment agreement, Ms. Lanier is currently subject to an additional 10% salary reduction. In </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">addition to base salary, the agreement provides that Ms. Lanier will be awarded an annual bonus </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">determined by the Board or the Human Resources Committee in accordance with US Airways </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Group&#146;s ICP (or successor
plan). Ms. Lanier&#146;s target percentage under the annual ICP each year will </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">be no less than 60% of her base salary, and her maximum bonus opportunity
each year will be no less </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">than 120% of base salary. Ms. Lanier is eligible to participate in the LTIP with a target percentage no </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">less than 80% of her base salary, and a maximum percentage no less than 160% of base salary. The </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">agreement provides that Ms. Lanier will receive supplemental executive retirement benefits (which she </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">now receives through
participation in the Company&#146;s Executive Plans, subject to a 25% reduction </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">provided in the letter agreement that amended the employment agreement),
and is entitled to equity </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">awards consistent with those provided to other Executive Vice Presidents. Ms. Lanier is also entitled </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">to participate in all incentive, savings, retirement and welfare benefit plans provided to other key </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">employees. Under the agreement, Ms. Lanier is entitled to fringe benefits, office and support staff, and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">paid vacation, all
in accordance with the most favorable practices with respect to other key employees. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">During 2004, those benefits included on-line first class, positive
space travel privileges for business </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">and pleasure for Ms. Lanier and her eligible family members, as well as a limited number of non- </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">eligible family members and unrelated persons, a gross-up payment (up to a maximum of $10,000) to </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">cover her tax liability resulting from such travel, free access to US Airways Club facilities for her and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">her eligible
family members, an annual car allowance, and certain relocation benefits including up to </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">24 months of reasonable temporary living expenses. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Termination of Employment</I>. Ms. Lanier&#146;s employment may be
terminated at any time by mutual </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">agreement, and terminates automatically upon her death. US Airways may also terminate the </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">agreement upon written notice after six months of Ms. Lanier&#146;s continuous total and permanent </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">disability, if Ms. Lanier does not return to work within 90 days after the written notice. US Airways </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">may also terminate
the agreement at any time for &#147;cause&#148; (as defined in the agreement). Ms. Lanier </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">may voluntarily terminate her employment, which may constitute
termination for &#147;good reason&#148; upon </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">certain events defined in the agreement. In the event of any termination by US Airways for cause or
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">by Ms. Lanier for good reason, the terminating party must give written notice that indicates the </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">specific termination provision in the agreement that is relied upon and sets forth in reasonable detail </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the facts and circumstances that are the basis for the termination, as well as the termination date, which </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">may not be more
than 15 days after the notice date. In the event of a dispute regarding termination, the </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">agreement and compensation continue in effect until the earlier of
the resolution of the dispute or the </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">end of the term of the agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Obligations Upon Termination</I>. If Ms. Lanier&#146;s employment is terminated for cause, due to death </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">or disability, or is voluntarily terminated by Ms. Lanier without &#147;good reason,&#148; US Airways must pay </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">all salary (disregarding any impermissible salary decrease), deferred compensation and vacation </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">accrued through the date of termination within 30 days of the date of termination. If Ms. Lanier&#146;s </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">employment is
terminated due to death or disability, or is voluntarily terminated by Ms. Lanier without </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;good reason,&#148; US Airways must also pay a prorated
annual bonus based on the amount of Ms. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Lanier&#146;s annual bonus for the previous fiscal year. If, prior to a change of control and not in </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">connection with a change of control, US Airways terminates Ms. Lanier&#146;s employment other than for </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">cause, disability or death or if Ms. Lanier terminates her employment for good reason: (i) US Airways </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">will pay to Ms.
Lanier a lump sum in cash within five days after the date of termination equal to the </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">aggregate of Ms. Lanier&#146;s accrued but unpaid base salary
(disregarding any impermissible reductions), </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">a prorated annual bonus (based on the higher of the target bonus applicable under the agreement, the
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">bonus paid during, or the bonus paid with respect to, the most recent fiscal year), two times the sum of </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">such annual base salary and Ms. Lanier&#146;s target annual bonus for the year in which the termination </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">occurs, any previously deferred compensation, and any accrued vacation pay; and (ii) for two years </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">after the date of
termination, US Airways will continue benefits to Ms. Lanier and/or her family as if </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the agreement had continued. If, after a change of control or prior to
a change in control and in </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">connection with a change of control, US Airways terminates Ms. Lanier&#146;s employment other than for </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">cause, disability or death or if Ms. Lanier terminates her employment for good reason: (i) US Airways </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">will pay to Ms. Lanier a lump sum in cash within five days after the date of termination equal to the </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">114 </FONT></P>

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">aggregate of Ms. Lanier&#146;s accrued but unpaid base salary (disregarding any impermissible reductions), </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">a prorated annual bonus (based on the higher of the target bonus applicable under the agreement, the </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">bonus paid during, or the bonus paid with respect to, the most recent fiscal year), three times the sum </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">of such annual base
salary and such annual bonus, any previously deferred compensation, any accrued </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">vacation pay, and an amount equal to the amount of additional benefits Ms.
Lanier would receive </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">under all US Airways retirement plans if Ms. Lanier continued employment through the term of the </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">agreement; (ii) for purposes of eligibility for retiree benefits, Ms. Lanier shall be considered to have </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">remained employed and retired on the last day of the term of the agreement; (iii) for three years after </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the date of
termination, US Airways will continue benefits to Ms. Lanier and/or her family as if the </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">agreement had continued; and (iv) at the end of the three-year
period, US Airways will continue health </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">insurance and on-line travel privileges to Ms. Lanier for life. In addition, as a participant in the LTIP,
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">upon a change of control, she would be eligible for a payment for each three-year performance period </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">under the LTIP that has not yet been completed in an amount that would have been payable to her if </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">target performance had been met for each performance period. Further, upon termination of Ms. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Lanier&#146;s employment for
any reason following the completion of at least 5 years of service, </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">US Airways will continue to provide Ms. Lanier with on-line travel privileges for life.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Other Obligations</I>. US Airways agreed to pay Ms.
Lanier&#146;s reasonable legal fees and expenses </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">incurred as a result of any contest by US Airways or others of the validity or enforceability of, or
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">liability under the agreement, plus interest. In addition, in the event that any of Ms. Lanier&#146;s </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">compensation (whether required under the agreement or otherwise) would be subject to an excise tax </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">under Internal Revenue Code Section 4999, US Airways is required to pay Ms. Lanier an additional </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">gross-up payment, such
that after payment of all taxes, including interest or penalties, on the gross-up </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">payment, Ms. Lanier will retain an amount of the gross-up payment equal
to the excise tax (and any </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">penalties and interest on the excise tax). Ms. Lanier agreed to hold US Airways Group&#146;s and </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">US Airways&#146; secret or confidential information, knowledge or data as confidential, including after </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">termination of employment. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2"><I>Severance Agreement with Alan W. Crellin </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">US
Airways&#146; Severance Agreement with Mr. Crellin is dated as of June 26, 2002 and is filed as </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Exhibit 10.9 to US Airways&#146; Annual Report on Form 10-K
for the year ended December 31, 2002. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Severance Agreement was amended by letter agreements dated July 25, 2002 and October 20, </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2004, which are filed as Exhibits 10.17 to US Airways&#146; Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ended December 31, 2002 and Exhibit 10.37 to this Annual Report, respectively. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Term of Employment</I>. The agreement provides for Mr. Crellin to serve as Executive Vice President </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">of US Airways for an initial term of three years, to be extended each year by one additional year unless </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">either US Airways or Mr. Crellin provides notice that the term will not be extended, or, if a shorter </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">period, until the
first day of the month following Mr. Crellin&#146;s 65</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#000000"><SUP>th</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000"> birthday (which is defined in the </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">agreement as Mr. Crellin&#146;s &#147;normal retirement date&#148;). Upon a &#147;change of control&#148; (as defined in the </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">agreement), the term of the agreement is automatically extended to the third anniversary of the date of </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the change of control or through Mr. Crellin&#146;s normal retirement date, whichever is earlier. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Salary and Benefits</I>. The agreement does not specify Mr. Crellin&#146;s salary and benefits prior to the </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">date of a change of control. However, pursuant to the letter agreement that amended the severance </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">agreement, Mr. Crellin became subject to a 17% and an additional 10% salary reduction and a 25% </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">reduction in retirement
plan contributions effective October 11, 2004. Beginning on the date of a </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">change of control and continuing for a period of three years thereafter, or until
Mr. Crellin&#146;s normal </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">retirement date, if earlier, the agreement provides for minimum salary and benefits that must be </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">provided to Mr. Crellin. US Airways will pay Mr. Crellin a base salary for the first 12 months of such </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">period at a rate not less than his base salary in effect on the date of the change of control. Mr. Crellin&#146;s </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">salary
may not be decreased thereafter and must be increased in accordance with pay increases </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">provided to other executive vice president level employees. In
addition, Mr. Crellin will be awarded </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">an annual bonus determined by the Board or the Human Resources Committee in accordance with </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">115 </FONT></P>

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">US Airways Group&#146;s ICP or successor plan. In addition to base salary and annual bonus, Mr. Crellin </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">will be entitled to participate in all incentive, savings, retirement and welfare benefit plans applicable </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">to executive vice president level employees, under terms at least as favorable as the most favorable </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">plans provided during
the 90-day period prior to the change of control. Mr. Crellin will also be </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">entitled to fringe benefits, including but not limited to space positive and
space available travel </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">privileges in all classes of service and cabins on all air carriers owned by US Airways and any of its </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">affiliates, including all carriers owned by any individual, entity or group that has entered into an </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">agreement that constitutes a change of control, and to paid vacation under terms at least as favorable as </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the most
favorable travel privileges and vacation program provided during the 90-day period prior to </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the change of control. Mr. Crellin will continue to be entitled
to all of the foregoing compensation and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">benefits, if applicable, during the first six months of Mr. Crellin&#146;s total and permanent disability.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Termination of Employment</I>. Mr. Crellin&#146;s
employment may be terminated at any time by mutual </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">agreement, and terminates automatically upon his death. US Airways may also terminate the </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">agreement upon written notice after six months of Mr. Crellin&#146;s continuous total and permanent </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">disability, if Mr. Crellin does not return to work within 90 days after the written notice. US Airways </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">may also terminate
the agreement at any time for &#147;cause&#148; (as defined in the agreement). Mr. Crellin </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">may voluntarily terminate his employment, which may constitute
termination for &#147;good reason&#148; upon </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">certain events defined in the agreement. In the event of any termination by US Airways for cause or
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">by Mr. Crellin for good reason within three years after a change of control and before Mr. Crellin&#146;s </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">normal retirement date, the terminating party must give written notice that indicates the specific </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">termination provision in the agreement that is relied upon and sets forth in reasonable detail the facts </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">and circumstances
that are the basis for the termination, as well as the termination date, which may not </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">be more than 15 days after the notice date. For post-change of
control terminations, in the event of a </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">dispute regarding termination, the agreement and compensation continue in effect until the earlier of </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the resolution of the dispute, Mr. Crellin&#146;s normal retirement date, or the third anniversary of the date </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">of the change of control. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Obligations Upon Termination</I>. If Mr. Crellin&#146;s employment is terminated for cause, due to death </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">or disability, or is voluntarily terminated by Mr. Crellin without &#147;good reason,&#148; US Airways must pay </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">all salary, deferred compensation and vacation accrued through the date of termination within 30 days </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">of the date of termination. If termination is due to death or disability and occurs within three years </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">after a change of
control and before Mr. Crellin&#146;s normal retirement date, US Airways must also pay a </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">prorated annual bonus based on the amount of Mr. Crellin&#146;s
annual bonus for the previous fiscal year. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If, prior to a change of control and not in connection with a change of control, US Airways terminates
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr. Crellin&#146;s employment other than for cause, disability or death or if Mr. Crellin terminates his </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">employment for good reason, US Airways will pay to Mr. Crellin in a lump sum in cash within 30 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">days after the date of termination the aggregate of Mr. Crellin&#146;s accrued but unpaid base salary, </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">deferred
compensation and benefits, plus an amount equal to two times the sum of his annual rate of </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">base salary and his target annual bonus. If, after a change of
control, or prior to a change of control but </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">in connection with a change of control, US Airways terminates Mr. Crellin&#146;s employment other than
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">for cause, disability or death or if Mr. Crellin terminates his employment for good reason: (i) </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">US Airways will pay to Mr. Crellin a lump sum in cash within 30 days after the date of termination </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">equal to the aggregate of Mr. Crellin&#146;s accrued but unpaid base salary (disregarding any impermissible </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">reductions in
Mr. Crellin&#146;s salary), a prorated annual bonus (based on the higher of the target bonus </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">immediately in effect prior to the change of control, the
bonus paid during, or the bonus paid with </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">respect to, the most recent fiscal year ending after the change of control), three times the sum of such
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">annual base salary and such annual bonus, any previously deferred compensation, and any accrued </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">vacation pay; (ii) for three years after the date of termination, US Airways will continue benefits to Mr. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Crellin and/or his family as if the agreement had continued; (iii) for purposes of eligibility for </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">retirement, Mr. Crellin
shall be considered to have remained employed until the third anniversary of </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the date of termination; and (iv) US Airways will provide continuation of
travel privileges for life. In </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">addition, as a participant in the LTIP, upon a change of control, he would be eligible for a payment for </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">each three-year performance period under the LTIP that has not yet been completed in an amount that </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">would have been payable to him if target performance had been met for each performance period. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">116 </FONT></P>

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Upon termination of Mr. Crellin&#146;s employment for any reason following the fifth anniversary of his </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">date of employment, he will be entitled to lifetime travel privileges. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Other Obligations</I>. US Airways agreed to pay Mr. Crellin&#146;s reasonable legal fees and expenses </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">incurred as a result of any contest by US Airways or others of the validity or enforceability of, or </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">liability under the agreement, plus interest. In the case of a contest regarding (i) payments upon </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">termination of Mr.
Crellin&#146;s employment prior to a change of control and not in connection with a </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">change of control other than for cause, disability or death or
termination by Mr. Crellin for good </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">reason, or (ii) lifetime travel privileges following Mr. Crellin&#146;s fifth anniversary of employment, </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">US Airways is only required to make such payments if Mr. Crellin prevails on at least one material </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">issue in such contest. In addition, in the event that any of Mr. Crellin&#146;s compensation (whether </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">required under the
agreement or otherwise) would be subject to an excise tax under Section 4999 of </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the Internal Revenue Code, US Airways is required to pay Mr. Crellin an
additional gross-up payment, </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">such that after payment of all taxes, including interest or penalties, on the gross-up payment, Mr. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Crellin will retain an amount of the gross-up payment equal to the excise tax (and any penalties and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">interest on the excise tax). Mr. Crellin agreed to hold US Airways Group&#146;s and US Airways&#146; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">confidential and
proprietary information as confidential, including after termination of employment. If </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr. Crellin violates this confidentiality agreement, any payments
due under the agreement are </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">forfeited. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>First Amendment to Severance Agreement</I>. US Airways entered into a First Amendment to Mr. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Crellin&#146;s Severance Agreement on March 31, 2003 that is filed as Exhibit 10.3 to US Airways&#146; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q for the quarterly period ended March 31, 2003. The Amendment </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">provides that (1) no change of
control will be deemed to have occurred in connection with transactions </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">under the RSA investment agreement or in connection with US Airways&#146; emergence
from the Prior </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Bankruptcy and (2) any relocation of US Airways&#146; headquarters outside of the Washington, D.C. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">metropolitan area will constitute good reason for Mr. Crellin to terminate his employment. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Severance Agreement with Jerrold A. Glass </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">US Airways&#146; Severance Agreement with Mr. Glass is dated as of April 8, 2002 and is filed as </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Exhibit 10.10 to US Airways&#146; Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2002. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Severance Agreement was amended by letter agreements dated July 25, 2002 and October 20, </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2004, which are filed as
Exhibit 10.18 to US Airways&#146; Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ended December 31, 2002 and Exhibit 10.40 to this Annual Report, respectively.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Term of Employment</I>. The agreement provides for Mr.
Glass to serve as Senior Vice President of </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">US Airways for an initial term of three years, to be extended each year by one additional year unless
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">either US Airways or Mr. Glass provides notice that the term will not be extended, or, if a shorter </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">period, until the first day of the month following Mr. Glass&#146;s 65</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#000000"><SUP>th</SUP></FONT><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000"> birthday (which is defined in the </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">agreement as Mr. Glass&#146;s &#147;normal retirement date&#148;). Upon
a &#147;change of control&#148; (as defined in the </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">agreement), the term of the agreement is automatically extended to the third anniversary of the date of
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the change of control or through Mr. Glass&#146;s normal retirement date, whichever is earlier. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Salary and Benefits</I>. The agreement does not specify Mr. Glass&#146;s
salary and benefits prior to the </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">date of a change of control. However, pursuant to the letter agreements that amended the severance </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">agreement, Mr. Glass became subject to a 17% and an additional 10% salary reduction and a 25% </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">reduction in retirement plan contributions effective October 11, 2004. Beginning on the date of a </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">change of control and
continuing for a period of three years thereafter, or until Mr. Glass&#146;s normal </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">retirement date, if earlier, the agreement provides for minimum salary
and benefits that must be </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">provided to Mr. Glass. US Airways will pay Mr. Glass a base salary for the first 12 months of such </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">period at a rate not less than his base salary in effect on the date of the change of control. Mr. Glass&#146;s </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">salary may not be decreased thereafter and must be increased in accordance with pay increases </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">provided to other senior vice president level employees. In addition, Mr. Glass will be awarded an </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">annual bonus determined
by the Board or the Human Resources Committee in accordance with </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">117 </FONT></P>
